pages.text: Hapsidophyllas flexibilis comes from the Upper Ediacaran, with fossils found from Newfoundland, Canada. It is a lifeform comprised of many leaf-like shapes joined together by a central rod, and could grow up to 33 cm in length, and possibly partook in filter feeding from the surrounding water.
The generic name derives from the Greek Words 'hapsis', to mean 'Network/Mesh'; and 'phyllon', to mean 'leaves'. Its specific name derives from the Latin word 'flexibilis', to mean 'flexible'.
